radiculopathy.definition: A condition in which a nerve root is compressed or irritated, causing pain, numbness, tingling, or weakness that radiates along the path of the nerve.

cervicalgia.definition: Pain in the neck region, often resulting from muscle strain, poor posture, or injury to the cervical spine.

cyclobenzaprine.definition: A muscle relaxant used to treat muscle spasms and associated pain. Often prescribed for short-term relief of musculoskeletal conditions.

acdf.definition: A surgical procedure that removes a damaged disc from the neck (cervical spine) and fuses the vertebrae above and below to stabilize the spine.
